title: YouTube star's parents drive him around in bed of Orbeez
title_page: YouTube star's parents drive him around in bed of Orbeez | Daily Mail Online
text:
The parents of an eight-year-old YouTube star have been accused of child endangerment after they drove him and a young woman around in the back of a pick-up truck full of gel-like beads.
Corona Police reviewed two videos posted to a YouTube channel that has more than one million followers and cited Holly Piazza, 45, the boy's mother, and Brian Chase, 37, for child endangerment of Piazza's son.
In their latest stunt for the channel, the family filled the bed of their white Dodge pick-up truck with Orbeez, which are a gel type material that absorbs water and swells 100- 300 times its original volume.

Corona Police reviewed two videos posted to a YouTube channel that has more than one million followers and cited Holly Piazza (left), 45, the boy's mother, and Brian Chase (right), 37, the boy's stepfather, for child endangerment of Piazza's son
In their latest stunt for the channel, the family filled the bed of their white Dodge pick-up truck (pictured) with Orbeez, which are a gel type material that absorbs water and swells 100- 300 times its original volume
One video showed the family lining the truck bed with plastic sheeting as they opened bags of the Orbeez and threw them in the water.
After the beads swelled, the boy and the young woman, who is jumped in the back of the truck as his parents backed out of their driveway and drove to a main street not far from their home.
The boy and the young woman were were lying in the bed of the Dodge as it was driven through heavy traffic on roadways throughout Corona.
At one point the pair swished close to the edge of the truck as it was driven from their home.
The Corona Police Department said in a statement that they received information through social media avenues that there were two uploaded YouTube videos that depicted 'dangerous driving behavior involving children'.
Police said they were in the back of the truck without any type of safety equipment while the driver slowed down and sped up as they drove through heavy traffic.

'Additionally, after the family was done with the Orbeez material, they dumped all of it on Rimpau Avenue near Erick Street, creating a dangerous roadway condition for motorists,' police said.
The Department of Water and Power was notified after the Orbeez material spilled into the sewer drains.
Piazza and Chase were both cited for illegally dumping materials on the roadways and were ordered to pay for the cost of road cleanup.
Piazza was also issued a traffic citation for illegally dumping materials upon the roadway.
